item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: Oh, and as I mentioned, I love (early) squeeze too. I never realized they were critical darlings, though.
item.content:encoded: Oh, and as I mentioned, I love (early) squeeze too. I never realized they were critical darlings, though.

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: Look at this diagram of band members over the last 30 years. http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/timeline/b762da14bfbfef5d920ad5833a95e318.png
item.content:encoded: Look at this diagram of band members over the last 30 years. http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/timeline/b762da14bfbfef5d920ad5833a95e318.png

item.title: By: Eric Greenwood
item.dc:creator: Eric Greenwood
item.description: British Menudo? Ouch. That's crazy insulting for a band that's always been a critical darling. I love early Squeeze. And Elvis Costello produced (most of) East Side Story.
item.content:encoded: British Menudo? Ouch. That’s crazy insulting for a band that’s always been a critical darling. I love early Squeeze. And Elvis Costello produced (most of) East Side Story.

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description:
I guess I just sort of always thought of them as cheesy mainstream pop from the '70s/'80s. I used to have a tape copy of the Singles that I played so much that it warbled and eventually snapped.
They're also kinda like the British Manudo with all their lineup changes and incarnations over the years.
item.content:encoded:
I guess I just sort of always thought of them as cheesy mainstream pop from the ’70s/’80s. I used to have a tape copy of the Singles that I played so much that it warbled and eventually snapped.

They’re also kinda like the British Manudo with all their lineup changes and incarnations over the years.

item.title: By: ajw
item.dc:creator: ajw
item.description: Guilty?!? :) I've been a hardcore Squeeze fan most of my adult life. In fact, if I had to name my favorite song of the eighties, it would be "Black Coffee in Bed." My husband loved the use of the iPad in the Fallon appearance.
item.content:encoded:
Guilty?!? ðŸ™‚ I’ve been a hardcore Squeeze fan most of my adult life. In fact, if I had to name my favorite song of the eighties, it would be “Black Coffee in Bed.”
My husband loved the use of the iPad in the Fallon appearance.
